title: Inefficient Peace or Preventive War?. (arXiv:2111.15598v2 [econ.GN] UPDATED)
abstract: We study a model of two-player bargaining game in the shadow of a preventive trade war that examines why states deliberately maintain trade barriers in the age of globalization. Globalization can induce substantial power shifts between states, which makes the threat of a preventive trade war salient. In this situation, there may exist "healthy" levels of trade barriers that dampen the war incentives by reducing states' expected payoffs from such a war. Thus, we demonstrate that trade barriers can sometimes serve as breaks and cushions necessary to sustain inefficient yet peaceful economic cooperation between states. We assess the theoretical implications by examining the US-China trade relations since 1972.

translated_title: 低效的和平还是预防性战争？——从贸易战到贸易制裁的两国谈判博弈模型
translated_abstract: 本文研究了一种在预防性贸易战阴影下进行的两国谈判博弈模型，探讨了在全球化时代为什么国家会有意维持贸易壁垒。全球化可能导致国家之间的实力转移，使得预防性贸易战的威胁显著。在这种情况下，可能存在“健康”的贸易壁垒，通过降低国家从此类战争中预期获得的回报来减缓战争的动因。因此，我们证明了贸易壁垒有时可以作为所需要的制动器和缓冲器，以维持国家之间低效但和平的经济合作。通过研究自1972年以来的美中贸易关系，我们评估了理论上的影响。
tldr: 本文研究了一种预防性贸易战阴影下的两国谈判博弈模型，发现适度的贸易壁垒可以降低国家间从战争中预期获得的回报，维持国家之间低效但和平的经济合作。
en_tdlr: The article studied a two-player bargaining game model in the shadow of a preventive trade war and found that moderate trade barriers could reduce expected payoffs from war, promoting inefficient but peaceful economic cooperation between states. The study evaluated the theoretical implications by examining the US-China trade relations since 1972.
